meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be deducted.
meanings.sent1: The deductibility of business expenses helps reduce taxable income.
meanings.sent2: Tax laws determine the deductibility of certain expenses for individuals.
meanings.sent3: The accountant found joy in the deductibility of the company's losses.
meanings.sent4: Her logic had the deductibility of a well-organized filing system.
meanings.sent5: Understanding deductibility is crucial for financial planning.

meanings.definition: The state of being eligible for deduction.
meanings.sent1: The deductibility of charitable donations benefits many taxpayers.
meanings.sent2: Homeowners should be aware of the deductibility of mortgage interest.
meanings.sent3: The family celebrated the deductibility of their medical expenses with a picnic.
meanings.sent4: His generosity had the deductibility of a golden heart.
meanings.sent5: The deductibility of student loan interest can help reduce financial burden.
